intro: Parasenecio nokoensis, commonly known as the Noko's parthenium, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the summer months. Parasenecio nokoensis is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along rocky outcrops.
